document_title: Heart arrhythmia: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Symptoms of patients with arrhythmia are very diverse, with many levels from mild to severe. Some patients have arrhythmia but have absolutely no symptoms, or the symptoms are quite vague such as feeling unwell or chest discomfort. Common symptoms of arrhythmia include:
Nervous; Feeling of palpitations/strong heartbeat; Short of breath; Shortness of breath; Chest rash; Weakness
Shortness of breath and difficulty breathing are common symptoms of arrhythmia
In addition, symptoms related to arrhythmia that need special attention because of the possibility of severe arrhythmia include:
Chest pain; Sweating; Dizziness, lightheadedness, dark eyes; Near fainting or fainting; Dead
Some arrhythmias have almost no significant impact on health such as atrial premature beats or sparse ventricular premature beats - without symptoms. However, there are also types of arrhythmias that can impair heart function over time, or cause life-threatening symptoms. Therefore, when you have suspicious symptoms, especially severe symptoms such as fainting or near-fainting, you need to see an arrhythmia specialist for timely diagnosis and treatment.
